required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Puberty and Pubertal Suppression on Insulin Sensitivity, Metabolic Rate and Vascular Health

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study will evaluate the effect of puberty suppression on insulin sensitivity, metabolic rate and vascular health among transgender female youth at baseline and 6 months after initiation of a gondoatropin releasing hormone agonist compared to matched cisgender male controls.

primary_outcome.description: Insulin sensitivity assessed by the oral minimal model

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition (fat mass, fat-free mass)

secondary_outcome.description: Resting metabolic rate assessed by indirect calorimetry
Endothelial function assessed by brachial artery flow mediated dilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in large elastic artery stiffness
secondary_outcome.description: Large elastic assessed by carotid ultrasound
Middle cerebral artery blood flow assessed using bilateral transcranial Doppler

arm_group.description: Transgender females who plan to start a gonadotropin releasing hormone agonist clinically in the next 2 months

study_pop.textblock: 15 transgender females (male sex assigned at birth, female gender identity) and 15 cisgender males

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Identify as a transgender female or cisgender male
- Age 9-14 years at the time of enrollment
- Tanner Stage 2-3 baseline pubertal development
- Plan to start gonadotropin releasing hormone analogue clinically in < 2 months (for transgender females only)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive, psychiatric, or physical impairment resulting in inability to tolerate the study procedures
- Type 1 or 2 diabetes (by medical history)
- On any medications that affect insulin sensitivity (e.g. metformin, antipsychotics)
- Hypertension (resting BP â‰¥ 140/90 mm/Hg)
- Weight > 400 lbs
- On estrogen- or progesterone-containing medications at baseline
- >3 hours of moderate-to-vigorous physical activity on the 3DPAR at the screening visit
